images.imageCaption: Most of the Peace-Athabasca Delta lies within Wood Buffalo National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Its wetlands provide habitat for more than 200 species of birds and 20 fish species, as well as dozens of mammals, including muskrats. \ Image credit: Shutterstock

Most of the Peace-Athabasca Delta lies within Wood Buffalo National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Its wetlands provide habitat for more than 200 species of birds and 20 fish species, as well as dozens of mammals, including muskrats. \ Image credit: Shutterstock
